pages.title: Train Monitor
pages.text: A visual $(thing)CTC-style train network map$() displayed on a multi-block monitor. Shows real-time train positions, station names, signal states, and track topology.$(br2)No peripheral API — this is a display-only block.
Place multiple monitors in a grid (up to 10×10) to create a larger display.

pages.title: Multi-Block Setup
pages.text: $(bold)Building a display:$()$(br)$(li)Place Train Monitors in a flat wall$(br)$(li)They auto-detect adjacent monitors$(br)$(li)Max size: 10 wide × 10 tall$(br)$(li)Right-click to open the map GUI$(br2)$(bold)Map Features:$()$(br)$(li)Track graph drawn as connected lines$(br)$(li)$(#55FF55)Green$() stations with names$(br)$(li)Moving train icons with names$(br)$(li)$(#FF5555)Red$() / $(#55FF55)Green$() signal indicators$(br)$(li)Pan and zoom with mouse$(br)$(li)Click trains or stations for details

pages.title: Display Modes
pages.text: The monitor renders a $(thing)real-time schematic$() of the entire train network, similar to a Centralized Traffic Control (CTC) board.$(br2)$(bold)Display Modes:$()$(br)$(li)$(thing)MAP$() — graphical track topology view$(br)$(li)$(thing)LIST$() — text list of trains and stations$(br)$(bold)Sneak + right-click$() to toggle between modes.$(br2)$(bold)Color Legend:$()$(br)$(li)$(#AAAAAA)Gray lines$() — track segments$(br)$(li)$(#55FF55)Green dots$() — stations$(br)$(li)$(#FFAA00)Orange icons$() — moving trains$(br)$(li)$(#FF5555)Red signals$() — occupied blocks$(br)$(li)$(#55FF55)Green signals$() — clear
